My favorite FPS. I tried COD on a friend's computer once growing up. After that, I knew I'd love playing FPS games. Long story short, I avoided playing COD because I had my doubts about the community, then I bought CS Source. Immediately after trying it, I bought CSGO. Playing since 2015, and loved it ever since.

The cons though:
-Hit reg
-Changes to player models and bullet sprays have made low ping a vital prerequisite
-Rank resets have mixed highly skilled players in with newer ones, and at this point nearly everyone may as well be a smurf
-Cheaters: CSGO has had a rampant cheating problem that isn't getting much better. For the time-being expect to face off against a few nearly any time you log on.

All that being said, there's a lot that's great about this game. Between learning ideal use for utility, being rewarded for knowing spray patterns, occasionally having hilarious "silver duels", etc. this game is tons of fun. At the very least, it's worth a try.
